text: I feel like past wounds secretly shape my love life and relationships.
I notice that I repeat the same unhealthy relationship patterns from my past.
I feel like trauma from my past affects how I form and maintain relationships today.
I find myself attracted to people who remind me of past hurts or trauma.
I can recognize and break free from trauma patterns that affect my relationships.
I feel like I'm reliving past trauma in my current relationships.
I have difficulty trusting people because of past wounds and trauma.
I feel like my past trauma makes it hard for me to form healthy, secure attachments.
I can form healthy relationships despite past trauma and wounds.
I feel like I'm unconsciously recreating traumatic situations in my relationships.
I have processed my past trauma and it no longer significantly affects my love life.
I notice that certain triggers from my past trauma cause problems in my current relationships.
I can maintain healthy boundaries and avoid repeating trauma patterns in relationships.
I feel like my past wounds make me choose partners who are emotionally unavailable or unhealthy.
I can recognize trauma patterns and work to heal them so they don't affect my love life.
I feel like I'm stuck in cycles of trauma that repeat in my relationships.
I have difficulty opening up in relationships because of past trauma and wounds.
I feel like my past trauma has shaped my love life in ways I don't fully understand.
I can identify which wounds from my past are secretly shaping my love life.
I feel like I've healed from past trauma and can form healthy relationships without repeating old patterns.
